image.altText: a man standing with his arms folded next to a makeshift camp

props.synopsis: Homelessness has been rising across the country along with the cost of everyday necessities such as housing, food and electricity. Mick is asking for more support and less judgement for those, like himself, who are trying to turn their luck around.

title.children: Mick is one of a rising number of people in South Australia finding themselves without a home

image.altText: Researchers in protective suits conduct meth testing.

props.synopsis: Second-hand car buyers could potentially be at risk of third-hand exposure to methamphetamine, with new research examining the extent to which the drug spreads to surfaces such as dashboards in contaminated cars.

title.children: Meth research triggers warning to prospective second-hand car buyers

image.altText: Emmett Prime sings into a microphone  while holding a guitar and surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: Social media has been a "beautiful tool" to connect psychedelic-rock group Maisie to its audience, but a desire from music organisations and record labels for large social media engagement is having an impact on some live music acts accessing funding and opportunities.

title.children: Has social media become more important in music than the art itself?

image.altText: Zoe in her yellow Wiggle uniform (yellow skivy, a black skirt and tights) stands on an empty stage

props.synopsis: Like so many Australian children, Zoe Karatzovalis grew up watching The Wiggles. Now, she's gone from auditioning for The Wiggles with 160 other people to being introduced on stage by Anthony Field, the original Blue Wiggle, as Zoe Wiggle.

title.children: 'Surreal' moment for one of The Wiggles' newest recruits

image.altText: Two people holding glasses stand either side of a barrel with a bottle of brandy on top of it.

props.synopsis: Grapes damaged by a devastating bushfire in the Adelaide Hills in late 2019 have been turned into brandy. The research, led by the University of Adelaide, is part of a wider project aiming to help producers navigate the setbacks of climate change.

title.children: Grapes tainted by smoke from bushfire transformed into brandy

image.altText: A motorbike and car at a fatal crash scene.

props.synopsis: A driver who allegedly hit and killed a motorcyclist when his car ploughed through fencing on an Adelaide median strip on Tuesday afternoon will face court charged with causing death by dangerous driving, police say.

title.children: Man charged after motorcyclist killed, cops issue warning ahead of TDU

image.altText: Several police cars parked on a curved street, with officers standing outside, and trees in the background.

props.synopsis: South Australia's police chief says he has seen bodycam footage of an incident in which officers fatally shot an armed man at a home in Adelaide's south, saying those at the scene appeared to have taken the "necessary" steps to act in self-defence.

title.children: Police who fatally shot armed man took 'necessary' steps, commissioner says

image.altText: Police cars on the beach at Point Connor where two men died

props.synopsis: Two men died after their boat capsized when a rope became entangled as they were retrieving craypots. Police say the deaths are being considered "an accidental drowning".

title.children: Men who drowned near Beachport were pulling in craypots, SA Police say

image.altText: A firefighter battles a fire.

props.synopsis: Hurricane-force winds have sent wildfires ripping through the mountains and foothills around Los Angeles, leaving a trail of apocalyptic destruction in their wake.

title.children: In pictures: Apocalyptic scenes as wildfires tear through Los Angeles

image.altText: Jacob Vennix and Kimberley Fuller smile on their wedding day

props.synopsis: The heartbroken wife of Jacob Vennix, who drowned during their Bali honeymoon, says she will use the money to return him home and to donate a defibrillator to the hospital he was taken to after he was pulled from the ocean.

title.children: Wife of Bali drowning victim will use fundraiser to bring husband home

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis looking a tennis ball while hitting it with a racket.

props.synopsis: Australia's Rinky Hijikata continues to make the most of his late call-up at the Adelaide International, advancing to the quarterfinals with a tough three-set win over Brandon Nakashima.

title.children: Australia's Kokkinakis, Hijikata advance in Adelaide International

image.altText: A shirtless Justin Trudeau on a set of scales flexes his muscles

props.synopsis: On a recent trip to Canada I witnessed trucks flying "F*** Trudeau" flags and people wearing the slogan on T-shirts as others hurled insults at their once-loved PM.

title.children: Canada may never have another prime minister like Justin Trudeau

image.altText: Trump speaking at a microphone in an opulent gold room with a US flag behind him

props.synopsis: The German chancellor says the incoming US leader needs to respect fundamental principles of international law after Trump said the US "needs Greenland".

title.children: 'Incomprehension': EU leaders warn Trump against military action in Greenland

image.altText: Honey's logo of a happy lookig dancing gold coin

props.synopsis: Over the past two weeks, YouTube has been awash with videos about PayPal's browser extension Honey allegedly ripping off creators and it's led to a class action lawsuit. Here's a break down of what's going on.

title.children: Honey's bittersweet business model leads YouTube stars to launch class action

image.altText: Liam Payne smiles for camera

props.synopsis: Singer Liam Payne's cause of death has been confirmed as "polytrauma", the opening of a UK inquest into his final moments heard.

title.children: Liam Payne died of 'polytrauma', UK inquest hears

image.altText: An outback town with a tumbleweed rolling across the road. Stormclouds in the background

props.synopsis: With no local council or police station and one road in and out, you can understand why locals think this town is one of the "last frontiers".

title.children: No council, police station or rubbish pick-up: Life in Australia's 'Wild West'

image.altText: Crocodile eating barramundi at Cahills Crossing.

props.synopsis: Crocodile attacks are increasing in Timor-Leste. Australia's Northern Territory is home to the largest saltwater crocodile population in the world, but here a different scenario is playing out.

title.children: Crocodile attacks in Timor-Leste reach an all-time high

image.altText: a young woman smiling into the camera in an old photo

props.synopsis: Keith Lees was arrested last week over the alleged cold case murder of Meaghan Rose, whose body was found at the base of cliffs on the Sunshine Coast in 1997.

title.children: Sydney man to be extradited to Queensland over Meaghan Rose's alleged cold case murder

image.altText: A person on fire.

props.synopsis: Police say an arson attempt on a fast food outlet in Melbourne's east on Christmas Day ended with one alleged offender fleeing the scene with their own clothes on fire.

title.children: Alleged arsonist sets themselves alight during bungled Melbourne attack

image.altText: Black-and-white CCTV footage of five people around a car.

props.synopsis: Crime triples in Wondai from 13 offences in July to 41 in December 2024, the highest recorded in the past two years. Residents say they are scared in their own homes and want a local police presence to return.

title.children: Country town 'terrified' as crime rates triple with no local police

image.altText: Two people in hazmat suits crouch near a pile of rubbish on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: About 150 kilograms of powdered bleach "reacted" with another substance already in the truck, authorities say.

title.children: Garbage truck dumps load on Sydney street due to toxic vapour cloud

image.altText: a woman wearing a mask shopping inside a woman's clothing store

props.synopsis: The latest retail sales data shows a jump in spending during Black Friday sales. The ASX 200 opens lower, shares in Australian lithium producer leap after acquisition given the go-ahead. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog

title.children: Black Friday boosts retail spending, Rio Tinto gets green light on Arcadium takeover

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Huge leaps in spending for clothing, food and department stores
China set to meet 5% inflation target: ANZ

image.altText: pedestrians walk past the reserve bank of australia building

props.synopsis: An economic environment where it's harder to land a job may present a green light for the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates. But job vacancy figures could throw a spanner in the works.

title.children: Why the dollar moved swiftly after the release of critical mortgage data

image.altText: A message shown for Abdullah Hayayei

props.synopsis: The governing body for track and field in Britain and a sports official have been charged with manslaughter over the death of Paralympic athlete Abdullah Hayayei in 2017.

title.children: UK Athletics charged over death of Paralympic athlete

image.altText: Women seriously injured in sea plane crash at Rottnest Island.

props.synopsis: Investigators are set to recover and inspect the wreckage of the seaplane that crashed off Rottnest Island in Western Australia, as an aviation safety expert weighs in about the potential cause of the tragedy.

title.children: The search for answers over what went wrong before Rottnest plane crash

image.altText: Kim Jong Un and Kim Ju Ae walk along a beach with a city in the backgrounds.

props.synopsis: North Korea is set to open a long-awaited beachfront "tourist city" later this year as the "first big step" to developing the country's tourism industry.

title.children: 'One single, giant complex': North Korea to open 'tourist city' once taken over by homeless

image.altText: Andrew Forrest holding his chin at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Andrew Forrest and his charity IEJF have been accused in a defamation lawsuit by Exxon Mobil Corp of "a campaign to compete by turning the wheels of American justice to the company's self-interested purposes".

title.children: Andrew Forrest charity named in ExxonMobil defamation lawsuit

image.altText: A Fijian man in a green jacket and tropical-printed shirt, with a bald head, stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Moe Turaga would work over 60 hours a week, seven days, on a grape farm on the Victoria/NSW border. Two years into his work, Mr Turaga discovered he had not been paid a cent.

title.children: Moe Turaga came to Australia for a better life. He became a victim of modern slavery

image.altText: A man looks at two people standing in front of him, both out of focus.

props.synopsis: Former premier and now Northern Tasmanian Football Association president Peter Gutwein says it would be reasonable for the state government to "have a conversation with the AFL" over the timeline.

title.children: 'It's obvious' Hobart stadium won't be built in time, former premier says

image.altText: A close up of a woman's hands holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: A Sydney high school senior has been referred to police by the NSW Department of Education for allegedly creating explicit deepfake pornographic images of his fellow students.

title.children: Sydney high schooler allegedly created explicit deepfakes of female students

image.altText: A man holds a shovel full of dung from a wheelbarrow up high to put into a metal smoker.

props.synopsis: Sending barrels on boats, foraging salty peat, and smoking the grain with sheep dung are just some of the lengths Tassie distillers will go to stand out in a crowded market.

title.children: In a crowded whisky market, some distillers are turning to unusual methods

image.altText: newspaper clipping in black and white of a younger man (the key person in story ) strapping his knee near a basketball court

props.synopsis: After playing a basketball match for 120 hours straight, Alan Morris's side had finally broken a world record. Or at least they thought they had until a paperwork bungle held up official recognition.

title.children: 52-year wait for longest basketball match world record finally over

image.altText: Jack wide shot

props.synopsis: Life for Kellie Moody and Ross McLennan has turned into a daily hell since their son, 27-year-old Jack McLennan, went missing in regional Queensland on October 4 last year. They fear he may have died by misadventure or foul play.

title.children: More Queensland police brought in to investigate 27yo's disappearance
